alert.note: Alert for Conway; Faulkner; Northwest Yell County; Perry; Pulaski; Saline; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Logan, Perry, southwestern Conway, southwestern Faulkner, central Saline, northeastern Yell, western Pulaski and southern Pope Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lake Dardanelle to near Pinnacle Mountain State Park. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Russellville... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Bryant... Morrilton... Perryville... Southwest Little Rock... Dardanelle... Shannon Hills... Atkins... Pottsville... Mayflower... Oppelo... Perry... Adona... Houston... Sequoya Park... Otter Creek... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and western Arkansas.
